title: Events Management: Strategy, Event Types and Customer Service
headline: This free course introduces you to the basic concepts of customer service and skills required to manage events.
description: This free online event planning course is an informative introduction for anyone who wishes to venture into the ever-evolving events management industry. The course focuses on some of the basic concepts, skills and factors to consider when starting as an events manager. Gain key knowledge about events management strategies and vital customer service skills as well as the main issues to consider when planning for different types of events.
courseDescription:
This free events management and customer service training course will equip you with the basic concepts and skills required to become a successful events planner. You will begin with an overview of the events management field and the various strategies involved. You will learn about the events management industry in detail, the qualifications and daily tasks required of an events planner, the strategic management of events and how to make your work easier by using events management and planning softwares.

Next you will learn about the customer service skills and personal qualities required to be an events planner. You will receive some tips on effective communication in events management including the importance of body language when dealing with clients. You will also learn the importance of delegating duties and how to implement this. You will find out how to schedule various activities and the art of proper communication as you plan for an event. Finally, you will learn about different types of events and the specific considerations to organize and plan for each one.

The event planning and customer service course comes with a series of informative questions to help with your revision and study, before you take the final assessment. By the end of the course you will have a strong understanding of the basics of events management. Events management is a thriving industry which requires organisation, determination and charisma. This customer service course will help you determine if you are a good fit for a career in the events industry. So why wait? Start learning today.

Start Course Now

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Identify the different types of events that you might create as an events planner.
    • Discuss the different skills you need as an events planner.
    • Recognise the reality of what it takes to be an events planner.
    • Recognise the opportunities that a certificate in events planning presents for students.
    • Identify what it takes to have a career in event planning.
    • Explain why event planners need to strategise.
    • Explain why budgeting is so important in events planning.
    • Outline the benefits of strategic management.
    • Compare various events management software.

  • Events Management

  • Everyday events management is a dynamic and challenging field. As an industry, it is constantly evolving and requires new and different types of expertise every year. As such, those who work in this industry are constantly growing, learning, and changing to keep up with the times.

    In this course, you will learn about what it takes to be an events manager in today’s world. This certificate course will provide you with the theoretical knowledge required to work in the industry and the practical skills you need to succeed. The certificate is perfect for anyone who wants to work in events, whether it is in corporate events, marketing events, or in wedding planning.
    Some of the major areas that the course covers include every type of event studied on an events management course, such as:
    • Sports.
    • Music.
    • Arts.
    • Corporate events.
    • Tourism.
    • Public and voluntary sectors.

  • What You Will Learn

  • Here, you will learn about skills that are unique to certain types of events like fundraising events, celebrity events and sporting events. You will begin to recognise that many of these events have a lot of similarities. Yet, at the same time, they have certain nuances. Being able to recognise these nuances will often determine whether your event is a good one or a great one.

    You’ll also learn about the various events management strategies as well as customer service skills that you need to apply to make sure that your events are successful.

    Finally, you’re going to explore the specific requirements you need to consider when planning for specific events such as sports events, private events, corporate events and many more.

  • Introduction

  • Events management is one of the most progressive businesses.

    There are many events planners that are doing exceptional work in making each event a magical experience. Events planners are hired for various occasions including festivals, conferences, lavish parties, concerts, college events and more. When a big event is being planned, many people reach for an events planning firm for professional assistance.

    It is not an easy job to do, and there are many aspects that have to be covered in order to produce a successful event. Before launching any event, an events planner makes sure that all the things are properly analysed. Even all the technical aspects are thoroughly investigated so that all parties are satisfied. At times, it can become stressful, so in order to begin to prepare you for this kind of management, we have summarised all of the techniques that will assist you in planning an accomplished event.

    Before you get started with your event, it is very essential that you should strategise your event properly and as soon as possible.

    Whatever strategy you take, you should be sure to create a solid plan of action. You should feel comfortable in organising the event and being prepared with a strategy will help facilitate this.

  • Software Options

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • If you are an events manager, you may know of some of the software options available.

    After all, to stay on top of your planning of events, whether weddings, birthday parties, or something else, you almost have to be digital. Technology has changed many fields, speeding up processing, allowing multitasking options that may not have been there for you in the past.
  • A bride and groom may come to you with some high expectations including ideas they want to have and things they want to avoid. 

    If you are a busy planner this may not be the only event that you are planning, but these details will still have to be juggled. Events management software options are going to help you keep everything more organized.

  • Lesson Summary

  • There are different types of events that an events planner can organize, they include: sports, music, arts and corporate events
  • Events planners can plan a wide variety of events, you can either Specialize to specific events or be a general events organizer.

    It is key to have solid leadership skills as an events manager since you will be dealing with different people.

    It is good to have certain qualifications and skills as an events manager. A Certificate in events management instills the knowledge and skills required.

    With a Certificate in Events Management, you can work with an agency or start your own Events management business.  

    You need to incorporate strategic management in events planning. Strategic Management ensures that you have a step by step implementation outlook of the event. There are software options available that an events manager can use to make them more efficient.

    Such software includes: etouches, eventbrite and boomset.

  • Planning

  • You are not in a career field where you have set hours. This means you should be available all the time. You don’t get holidays when you are an events planner, because most likely you’ll have an event you’ve planned, and are now attending to make sure it’s pulled off smoothly.

    Plan to work not only evenings but also weekends and bank holidays. You won’t be home very often unless that is your office! As a planner you’re going to have to make sure that everything is done on time, no missing deadlines: that can be something that will ruin your reputation and soon have you out of business.

    Don’t worry, there are software options out there that will help you manage your time more effectively, and not miss deadlines. But you have to also be organized enough to place the information into the software. A piece of paper sitting on your desk with information that needs to be placed into the program is not going to work. Before you know it, you’ll have missed deadlines all over the place, because you didn’t just sit down and place it all into software you’ve paid a pretty penny to help keep you on time.

    Taking on more than one project at a time can lead to problems if you’re not organized. Plus being so busy you never have time to relax can lead to burnout very quickly. With burnout will come the problem of just stopping all your career goals and quitting your job altogether.

  • Work on Your Communication Skills

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • There are many ways to go about improving your communication skills, all of which will assist you in becoming a better events planner.
  • From the little thought about ways to the more obvious, you just never know what it will take to make the right impression on a possible client and win a huge contract, or just a wedding, when you are first beginning your career as an events planner.
  • Good communication: It’s All About the Body Language

    You may not think about it but how you move your body is a communication device, and one that can come across in certain ways. Body language can be a huge thing, and the non-verbal cues that someone gets from you can push them away, or bring them closer to you. It may not seem like something that is very important to you as an events planner, but it really does matter.

    Be sure that when you are talking to your clients you make eye contact, this is another part of body language. It can make the difference between someone feeling comfortable with you, or walking out of your office to go and find another person to do their wedding planning.

  • Lesson Summary

  • To be a successful events manager, you need to do the following: 
    • Develop excellent time management skills.
    • Be resourceful.
    • Have excellent communication skills.
    • Be passionate about your work.
    • Always be calm but firm.
  • To deliver excellent customer service you will at times have to go the extra mile for your clients.

    An Events manager need to prioritize tasks and accomplish the most important one’s first.

    After identifying all the tasks, you can delegate some when necessary and create a realistic schedule.

    Good communication skills start from the body language, the non-verbal cues that someone gets from you can push them away, or bring them closer to you.

  • When planning small and private events, you need to split your organisational activities into the following categories:
    • Before the event.
    • During the event.
    • Following the event.

  • Corporate Events

  • In many cases, corporate events aim to encourage team building and networking. Others may be designed to promote a particular product or innovation.

    Either way, you need to be aware of what is and is not appropriate in terms of corporate events organization.

    Whereas everyday events may be all about celebrating something, corporate events are about promoting something. 

    It could be a product, a new branch, or even just the company itself. Even when the event is only geared towards current employees, its existence is probably about promotion.

    In some cases, a corporate event may be about team building. Such as golfing weekends away, visits to obstacle courses, or specialist team building centres. For now, we’re going to focus on events that have a party feel.

  • Organizing a Celebrity Event

  • To the average events planner, whether they’re about to get into the industry or they’re already there, organising a celebrity event is a coveted position. It shows that you have great connections, and it gives you the chance to meet some seriously exciting people.

    The chances of someone who is new to organising events being able to arrange an official engagement on behalf of a celebrity are rare.

    However, you may find yourself becoming involved in one of the following:
    • Organizing a club night that involves a celebrity. These have become particularly popular lately, as reality TV stars become available for engagements.
    • Trying to find a celebrity who can attend a product launch or charity event.
    • Organizing other kinds of events that typically involve celebrities, such as charity football matches and festivals.

  • Assuming you have an approximate date, expected attendance level, type of event, and the type of exhibits (where applicable). Here are some of the most important things for you to consider for all event types:
    • New Tab

    • Enter your text here..

    • Wedding attendees will make the effort no matter, but no one wants a reception full of angry drivers that spent the last hour looking for a parking space, or have to continually leave to feed the meter. For exhibitions and conferences, especially when reliant on door tickets, transport is vital.

      So you should ask yourself the following questions about any venues you look at:

      • Is there regular public transport and what type?
      • How will that affect your audience type? Remember, business people at a conference will likely expense taxi fees, others will likely not.
      • How far from public transport is the venue? People, in general, do not like to walk; especially in their business attire.
      • Is there ample car parking facilities?
      • If necessary, is there coach parking? Are the roads sufficient to accommodate coaches?

    • Even the meteorologists cannot give accurate forecasts more than a day or two ahead, but this does not mean we should leave it in the lap of the Gods.

      If the venue is in an area you know, you will likely have a good idea what the likelihood of inclement weather would be given your dates.

      Otherwise, many weather websites will give you a breakdown by months of precipitation and temperatures.

      This will make a difference to whether the event is hosted inside or out, or at least whether coverings are needed. Weather may also impact the suitability of transport links for your venue.

      For some types of exhibit weather will be key. Special advice may be needed from the client/experts. Things that may seem weather-agnostic, can actually be very sensitive.

  • Lesson Summary

  • In this module, you learned about several key kinds of event, your role as an events planner when organizing them, and what to consider for each case.

    An events planner can organize various events including: small events, corporate events, conferences, fundraising events, events involving celebrities, sports events and hospitality events.

    While each event has a lot of similarities, many have their own unique approaches that’ll help you find success as an events planner.

    When planning for small and private events, you need to split and categorize your organizational activities into those before, during and after an event.

    Corporate events are done with an aim to encourageteam building and networkingor promote something such as a product or a new branch.

    You need to consider various key aspects such as theright location, specialist objectives, and photographer considerations.
